review: I am impressed by the performance over my wifi network.  I have tried the chromecast browser extension on both my chromebook and macbook.  Some services like youtube, hulu plus and netflix offer direct support that is high quality.  I have tried youtube and could see the difference. (I don't have netflix or hulu plus at this time.)  I have also tried casting a full screen browser window of an Amazon Prime video. Amazon Prime videos streaming doesn't directly support the chromecast (yet), but the chromecast browser plugin works well.  The color is a bit different and there is some latency between my computer's screen and the chromecast.  But the quality is still decent and I have seen no stuttering.  If and when amazon prime offers native support for the chromecast, I am sure it will be much better.  One limitation to be aware of is that audio from video sources that require plugins like silverlight does not come through.  So far this is not a big deal for me.
